comments.author: odolvlobo
comments.created_time: January 31, 2024, 07:19:52 AMLast edit: February 13, 2024, 12:35:11 AM by odolvlobo
comments.body: The video repeats a common misconception. Contrary to what the video says, the halving does not reduce the supply. The supply is always increasing every block until it reaches 21 million.Also, to say that each halving has triggered a significant increase in the price is another common misconception based on nothing more that cherry-picking the data. Not only are the increases that people like to point to happenning 1 to 2 years after the halving, but all of the other significant price increases that don't correspond to the halvings are conveniently ignored.

comments.author: dzungmobile
comments.body: The chart is a summary for past three halvings in Bitcoin history.The Bitcoin market is very volatile but if you zoom out, have a mindset of long-term investors, you will see Bitcoin price growth is very solid. Its prices on halving days are good examples for its growth.From $12 to $675 and $9,760, Bitcoin has been actually going through a long way.

comments.author: Julien_Olynpic
comments.body: With each new halving, its influence on the market should decrease. Now the vast majority of bitcoins have already been mined, and halving the block subsidy is unlikely to radically change the situation. In my opinion, now halving has more of a psychological effect. This is the news that the media and influencers are happy to discuss. And this event has the character of anticipation, and nothing fuels bullish sentiment more than anticipation. In fact, the halving will affect miners almost exclusively. Yes, this will be a big challenge for them. Especially for those who have a high cost of mining one bitcoin. I think that we will face the ruin of many small miners.

comments.author: dzungmobile
comments.body: Quote from: Julien_Olynpic on February 06, 2024, 02:46:29 AMWith each new halving, its influence on the market should decrease. Now the vast majority of bitcoins have already been mined, and halving the block subsidy is unlikely to radically change the situation. In my opinion, now halving has more of a psychological effect. This is the news that the media and influencers are happy to discuss.There are two things that possibly contribute to impacts on Bitcoin price by its halving. Halve of block subsidy which will be a hook for new investors because they will fell like Fear Of Missing Out (FOMO). Another thing is Bitcoin marketcap will become bigger and bigger with halvings till a time it is big enough to hardly have big price impacts.I agree that in future, Bitcoin halvings will have less effects than past events and some more in near future because of less scarcity feeling with block subsidy and bigger marketcap.QuoteAnd this event has the character of anticipation, and nothing fuels bullish sentiment more than anticipation. In fact, the halving will affect miners almost exclusively. Yes, this will be a big challenge for them. Especially for those who have a high cost of mining one bitcoin. I think that we will face the ruin of many small miners.It is true as in any market, people are easily manipulated by emotion and psychology. Their actions on the market will be seriously affected by emotion, psychology and the psychology cycle of market does not change, it actually repeats.
